column2: Pat, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: When I take 1-2 5mg of generic Zaleplon, I fall asleep quickly and stay asleep the remainder of the night. However I take several other prescritions at bedtime (for RLS, muscle cramps, chronic pain, anxiety) which may "enhance" the stay asleep effectiveness of this medication. I have found though that if I have to get up and stay up with less than 3-4 hours sleep post Zaleplon I am sometimes unsteady on my feet bumping into furniture or wall, experience mild confusion and exhibit nonsensical speech patterns (like inserting unrelated words into sentences or giving totally unrelated answers to questions, etc.) This atypical behavior lasts from just a few minutes to maybe an hour, decreasing over the time period. Therefore if I know I can only stay in bed for less than 4 hours I do not take the Zaleplon, which of course usually results in another sleepless night because I can't fall asleep - its a catch 22. BUT hey, when I CAN take the Zaleplon, I feel great the next day because I got a good night's sleep!!! Another plus, Zaleplon is very affordable.

column2: bluelava, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: poohbahcj, 75 or over Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I take zaleplon (the generic form of Sonata) when I wake up in the middle of the night after sleeping only 4-5 hours. It works quickly (10-20 minutes) and I sleep for another 3-4 hours which does give me a nice full night's sleep.  Because of its short-term effectiveness, I awake without any feeling of grogginess.  I have been using this medication for years now with absolutely no side effects.
